thread.title: Tennessee Titans Quarterback Marcus Mariota Out Sunday
thread.title_full: Tennessee Titans Quarterback Marcus Mariota Out Sunday

title: Tennessee Titans Quarterback Marcus Mariota Out Sunday
text:
Tennessee Titans Quarterback Marcus Mariota Out Sunday 
Updated: Fri, Oct 23 2015, 01:15 PM 
Stream WZTV Fox 17 Newscasts LIVE starting with Fox 17 This Morning at 4:30am, News at 5:30pm and News at 9pm & 10 pm 
By Terry McCormick via Titan Insider --Quarterback Marcus Mariota will be out for Sunday's game due to his sprained MCL. 
Mariota did not practice all week and will be replaced in the lineup by backup Zach Mettenberger . 
Titans coach Ken Whisenhunt said the combination of Mariota getting no practice time and the team wanting to ensure that he is healthy for the long-term led to the decision to sit him out this week against the Atlanta Falcons. 
“We're going to list him as out for this game. It's a combination of missing practice and not quite being there (physically). He's close, but it's a combination of those two things,” Titans coach Ken Whisenhunt said. “We decided that was the best way to go this week.” 
Mariota stayed in the game after suffering the MCL injury last Sunday on a low hit by the Dolphins' Olivier Vernon, but was evaluated on Monday and did not take any practice reps. That has the Titans turning to Mettenberger, who made six starts a year ago as a rookie, completing 107 of 197 passes for 1,412 yards with eight touchdowns and seven interceptions. 
ALSO READ: DGB Ready to Take on Bigger Role 
Mettenberger said he is less focused on himself being back in the lineup and more focused on trying to help the Titans end their four-game losing streak. 
“The important thing is we go out there and try to get a team win. That's ultimately my job. It doesn't matter who's out there at quarterback, everyone is expecting us to win a ballgame, and that's what I've been working toward,” Mettenberger said. 
Elsewhere on the injury front, the Titans will be without cornerback Perrish Cox, who is out with a hamstring injury and receiver Harry Douglas, who has a rib cartilage injury. In Douglas' case, the Titans may need to add a receiver, perhaps Rico Richardson, to the 53-man roster as they are down to just three healthy wideouts. 
Whisenhunt added that safety Michael Griffin, who was limited Friday with his sprained LCL in his left knee, would be a game-time decision. 
Vernon was fined a total of $37,363 by the NFL, according to reports for his two hits on Mariota, the low hit that injured his knee and a blow to the head later in the game.
